title: Romantic Valentine prompt page with evasive No button and Yes meme reveal

requirements.text: Create a single-page, romantic-themed Valentine prompt UI that asks the user: "Will you be my Valentine?" with two prominent options: "Yes" and "No", using a pink-and-white color scheme and a simple, polished layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

quotes: Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend... to ask her to be my Valentine... themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme and be fully interactive... run it on my iPad using Chrome

acceptanceCriteria: On load, the page shows a single clear prompt asking to be the Valentine and displays exactly two options labeled “Yes” and “No”.
The visual theme is consistently romantic with a pink-and-white palette (background, typography, buttons) and responsive spacing for tablet screens.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the "No" option as an evasive button that moves away when the user attempts to interact with it (hover on pointer devices and touch/pointer down on iPad), making it effectively impossible to click while remaining visible within the viewport.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: When the pointer hovers over the “No” button, it repositions away from the pointer.
On touch devices (iPad), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move before it can be clicked.
The “No” button never becomes permanently inaccessible off-screen; it stays within the visible page area after each move.
The “No” button does not trigger any “decline” flow or success state.

requirements.text: When the user clicks "Yes", transition the page to a success state that displays a meme image containing the message: "No pen, no paper but you still draw my attention" (exact wording), with a romantic presentation matching the page theme.

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "No pen, no paper but you still draw my attention"

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” switches the UI to a celebratory/success view (no longer shows the two-choice prompt as the primary content).
The success view displays the provided message exactly: “No pen, no paper but you still draw my attention”.
A meme-style image is shown in the success view (locally served as a static asset, not loaded from an external URL).

requirements.text: Add the required generated image(s) into the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the Yes success state.

quotes: show her a meme image telling her "No pen, no paper but you still draw my attention"

acceptanceCriteria: The generated image file(s) exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in imageRequirements.required.
The frontend references the image(s) via static asset paths and displays them after clicking “Yes”.

constraints: Use React + TypeScript with Tailwind CSS and existing UI components; do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
No external hosting, external databases, or third-party auth providers; keep the experience fully client-side.
Ensure interaction works on iPad Chrome (touch support in addition to hover behavior).
nonGoals: Building a multi-page site or adding additional features beyond the Valentine prompt and Yes success reveal.
Adding backend persistence, user accounts, or Internet Identity authentication.
Integrating external meme/image URLs or third-party APIs.

required: Meme-style romantic image with the text “No pen, no paper but you still draw my attention” in the design (valentine-meme.dim_1200x800.png)
